CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: [8][9][10][11] In recent efforts to develop high performance conjugated polymers , building blocks have been carefully designed for the conjugated polymers to have adequate energy levels , broad light absorption and strong self - assembly for use in BHJ PSC.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| conjugated polymers |
| BHJ PSC |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions two types of materials:

1. Conjugated polymers: These are a class of polymers that have alternating double and single bonds, which facilitate the delocalization of electrons, leading to unique optical and electrical properties. They are designed with specific energy levels and light absorption characteristics for use in bulk heterojunction photovoltaic solar cells (BHJ PSC).
2. BHJ PSC: This stands for Bulk Heterojunction Photovoltaic Solar Cells, which are a type of organic solar cell that uses a mixture of electron donor and acceptor materials to create a bulk heterojunction. This structure facilitates charge separation and transport, leading to improved solar cell efficiency.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| conjugated polymers |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions only one type of material that can be clearly identified as a "Material Name":

1. Conjugated polymers: These are a class of polymers that have alternating double and single bonds, which facilitate the delocalization of electrons, leading to unique optical and electrical properties. They are designed with specific energy levels and light absorption characteristics for use in bulk heterojunction photovoltaic solar cells (BHJ PSC).

BHJ PSC is not a material name, but a type of solar cell that uses a mixture of electron donor and acceptor materials, including conjugated polymers. Therefore, it is not included in the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: [8][9][10][11] In recent efforts to develop high performance conjugated polymers , building blocks have been carefully designed for the conjugated polymers to have adequate energy levels , broad light absorption and strong self - assembly for use in BHJ PSC.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| adequate energy levels |
| broad light absorption |
| strong self-assembly |

The three "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are "adequate energy levels," "broad light absorption," and "strong self-assembly." These entities refer to the desired properties of the conjugated polymers for use in bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells (BHJ PSC).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| adequate energy levels |
| broad light absorption |

After reviewing the entities, I have removed "strong self-assembly" as it is not a material property but rather a property of the assembly of the material. The remaining two entities, "adequate energy levels" and "broad light absorption," are material properties that are relevant to the development of high-performance conjugated polymers for use in BHJ PSC.

Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: [8][9][10][11] In recent efforts to develop high performance conjugated polymers , building blocks have been carefully designed for the conjugated polymers to have adequate energy levels , broad light absorption and strong self - assembly for use in BHJ PSC.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| high performance |
| adequate energy levels |
| broad light absorption |
| strong self-assembly |

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

* high performance (for conjugated polymers)
* adequate energy levels (for the conjugated polymers)
* broad light absorption (for the conjugated polymers)
* strong self-assembly (for the conjugated polymers)

These entities describe the desired properties of the building blocks of the conjugated polymers for use in BHJ PSC.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| adequate energy levels |
| broad light absorption |
| strong self-assembly |

After removing entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property", the valid "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

* adequate energy levels (for the conjugated polymers)
* broad light absorption (for the conjugated polymers)
* strong self-assembly (for the conjugated polymers)

These entities describe the desired properties of the building blocks of the conjugated polymers for use in BHJ PSC.

The entity "high performance" was removed because it is a general term that does not clearly refer to a specific material property.
